result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Scott Sokolik

records.addlTxt:
4:25 PM  Defendant Joshua Scott Sokolik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Joshua Scott Sokolik.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to attorney, address confirmed, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $250 set.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.C. or A.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  No contact with Lion's Quick Mart.  No intentional contact with Officer Katzenmeyer and no contact with his family.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
